name: Steve Bullock
tweet: For Montana families that can’t make their housing payment right now because they’ve lost income due to COVID-19, this will help prevent a months-long rent backlog from coming due all at once. https://nbcmontana.com/news/coronavirus/bullock-to-provide-rental-assistance-for-families …

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: As governor, I’ve always enjoyed visiting Montanans in their communities. While that’s not possible at this time, it’s especially important that I can hear from Montanans directly and answer their health and economic concerns related to COVID-19. Join us today! pic.twitter.com/5BNA4sJ3Jf

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: I am saddened to hear of another death due to COVID-19 in Montana and am thinking of the family and friends who are grieving the loss of this fellow Montanan. We must take all precautions to protect our family, friends, and Montana’s most vulnerable during this difficult time.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Happy Easter to all those celebrating, with loved ones at home or from afar. I’m reminded of hope, renewal, and resiliency on this day. pic.twitter.com/MJZHI2j7m9

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Dang! Your pitch is perfect

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Thanks, Mr. Thennis. Our dedicated principals, teachers and staff across Montana are missing their students.  Looking forward to the dance off! #gobengals https://twitter.com/thennis_steve/status/1248667095337816065 …

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Yesterday I visited Shelby, Montana for briefings of the on-the-ground situation as COVID-19 impacts the rural community. Thank you to all of the healthcare heroes and experts working hard to prevent further spread of the virus. Keep on keeping on Shelby. pic.twitter.com/UZo2GOR1oe

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: I recognize this is a difficult time for families across Montana and believe it’s especially important we remember to find ways to bring joy into our homes. That’s why I have deemed the Easter Bunny, Tooth Fairy, and other magical creatures as essential. pic.twitter.com/riO8B9jpjm

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Local and county governments are integral to the response to COVID-19. This directive ensures Montana taxpayers won’t be forced to pay a penalty to access federal aid to respond to the unprecedented economic situation caused by COVID-19. http://governor.mt.gov/pressroom/governor-bullock-issues-waiver-to-help-local-and-county-governments-access-federal-emergency-relief-funding …

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Montanans across the state have been relying on first responders and we’re incredibly grateful for everything they’ve done to fight COVID-19. This measure ensures first responders can safely do their jobs during this emergency. http://governor.mt.gov/pressroom/governor-bullock-announces-measure-to-protect-first-responders …

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: We sold bonds at a historically low interest rate to move forward with planning infrastructure projects across Montana. We are ensuring that when the time comes, we can immediately boost our economy by putting shovels to dirt and creating jobs. https://www.kpax.com/news/coronavirus/bullock-extends-stay-at-home-order-announces-sale-of-bonds-for-economic-recovery …

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: It’s also important to know that while cloth masks do help protect those around you, they should not be used as a replacement to social distancing or other protective measures such as washing your hands.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Please use cloth face coverings and not surgical masks or N95 masks which are needed by our health care workers and first responders.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: I encourage Montanans to wear a cloth mask or face covering, consistent with CDC guidelines, in public settings where other social distancing measures are difficult to maintain, such as at grocery stores or pharmacies.  https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/prevent-getting-sick/diy-cloth-face-coverings.html …

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: As we all work together to slow the spread of COVID-19, I’m daily reminded we are in this together. And we will get through it together. Thank you to all Montanans for your diligence and sacrifice during this time.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Managing this public health crisis now will help to prevent long-term consequences that could upend our economy for a longer duration and with a worse outcome.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: We also stay home so that we can more quickly rebuild to a thriving economy. It is not a choice between a healthy population and a healthy economy - the two go hand in hand.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: We stay home to protect Montanans in our rural communities and our rural health care workers who face long distances to access care. Though many Central and Eastern Montana counties don’t have a case yet, an outbreak in a rural community could overrun a local health care facility

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: We stay at home to ensure that our health care workers and first responders have adequate time to receive the supplies to keep them, their patients, and their families safe.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: We must do this for our frontline healthcare workers, our rural communities, and our economy. That is why I am extending the Stay At Home directive and related directives until April 24.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: We know that staying home will help flatten the curve. For every person we take out of the chain of transmission, the more likely our health care facilities can handle the capacity to respond. The more likely we beat back this virus sooner not later. pic.twitter.com/yKyy1aXMKc

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: A good reminder I passed by on my morning run. We are in this together.  And we’ll get through it! pic.twitter.com/lJWz6Zg9w2

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: No matter what challenges we face this year, Montanans will prevail. Our spirit and sense of community will carry us through. Happy #406Day to all Montanans. pic.twitter.com/M0SSpfD3oy

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: As we continue to do everything possible to protect Montanans from the spread of this virus, making sure children and families in our state don’t go hungry is a crucial priority. https://www.google.com/amp/s/www.kbzk.com/news/coronavirus/bullock-announces-actions-to-bolster-food-security-for-montana-families-during-covid-19-pandemic%3f_amp=true …

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: We stay at home to slow the spread and save lives, and to protect frontline health care workers in both urban and rural communities.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Today we solemnly learned of another death in Montana from COVID-19. My heart goes out to the loved ones of this fellow Montanan. Each loss of life impacts another community and another family – and indeed, all of us through our shared bond as Montanans.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Thank you, Montanans, for everything you're doing to play your part in slowing the spread of this virus. pic.twitter.com/sg9nGBqhoU

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: I'm calling for an extension to the Census deadline to accommodate COVID-19 health and safety measures. In Montana, we must ensure that everyone is counted. Our schools, hospitals, highways, communities and families depend on it. pic.twitter.com/rSfj8DyvrE

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Today is #CensusDay2020 and @LtGovMikeCooney and I are asking all Montanans to fill our their 2020 Census form. In fact, you can do so while staying at home to slow the spread of COVID-19. pic.twitter.com/NbaVan4Ate

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Our rural and urban hospitals serve on the frontlines of this crisis and they need our support to continue providing lifesaving care across the state. http://governor.mt.gov/pressroom/governor-bullock-announces-measure-to-keep-smaller-hospitals-open …

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: So long as this virus forces Montanans to stay home to save lives, Montanans need a home to stay in. This order ensures that a loss of income won’t lead to Montanans losing their homes or having their heat turned off. https://billingsgazette.com/news/state-and-regional/govt-and-politics/bullock-suspends-evictions-foreclosures-utility-shutoffs/article_bf9c310b-79c8-5d16-aac3-db0a70bf7823.html#tracking-source=home-breaking …

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Read the full directive here: http://governor.mt.gov/pressroom/governor-bullock-directs-14-day-quarantine-for-travelers-arriving-in-montana-from-another-state-or-country …

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: While we love our visitors, we would ask that you not come visit while Montanans are watching out for one another by staying at home. Today I directed that travelers arriving from another state or country to Montana for non-work-related purposes undergo a 14-day self-quarantine. pic.twitter.com/DkOf0HzLow

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Whether they work in a three bed rural clinic or our largest healthcare system, Montana’s doctors are against a lot these days. And they have risen to every challenge. Join me in thanking Montana’s doctors on this #NationalDoctors Day.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: We lost two more Montanans, a total of four, to COVID-19. This is a blow to our statewide community and a heartbreaking reminder to us all that we must continue to do everything we can to slow the spread of this disease.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: I’m saddened that a 2nd Montanan has died from COVID-19. No matter in which community we live, the impact of each loss of life has a ripple effect throughout the state and serves as a reminder of how serious this disease is. Our hearts go out to the loved ones of this Montanan.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet:
Thank you to:
The grocery store employees who work tirelessly 
The truck drivers who keep shelves stocked 
The emergency responders on duty
The teachers who are providing high quality education in creative ways

We’re cheering for all those on the frontlines of COVID-19. pic.twitter.com/xAk4BcIKeT

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: During the Stay at Home order, Montanans are still able and encouraged to responsibly enjoy our public lands. Follow social distancing requirements, avoid crowded trailheads, and recreate near the communities you live. It’s up to all of us to slow the spread of COVID-19. pic.twitter.com/Kt9sJbq5oQ

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Thank you to Montana’s health workers – doctors, nurses, CNAs, pharmacists and pharmacy techs, custodians, receptionists, and more – who fight COVID-19, while ensuring Montanans can access other essential medical care to stay healthy. Your work is the backbone of this battle.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: I’m heartbroken to learn of Montana’s first death due to COVID-19. Montana truly is one big small town – this news hits us hard, but we’re in this together. My family and I send our love and support to the family, friends, and community of our fellow Montanan.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: We are all in this together. We can get out in front of this together. And when the time comes again, we will rebuild a stronger community.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: In order to have a healthy economy we need a healthy population. We cannot rebuild our economic strength without doing everything we can now to flatten the curve and slow the spread of this virus.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: I am taking these measures today because we need to stay in front of this pandemic and slow the growth of infections.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: There’s no doubt that COVID-19 is causing a lot of hardship for Montana families. It’s also causing incredible hardships for our front line doctors, nurses and other hospital staff across the country.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Businesses and operations can find out if they are deemed essential in the directive at this link:  https://covid19.mt.gov/Portals/223/Documents/Stay%20at%20Home%20Directive.pdf?ver=2020-03-26-173332-177 …

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: In consultation with public health and emergency management experts, I have determined that to protect public health and human safety, it is essential, to the maximum extent possible, individuals stay at home or at their place of residence.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Locally elected officials best understand the voting needs of their communities. We can protect both the public’s health at a time we face unprecedented challenges with COVID-19 and the right to vote with this direction. https://helenair.com/government-and-politics/gov-counties-can-choose-all-mail-primary/article_047cf61a-7617-5f34-87fc-3e1f09094759.html#tracking-source=home-breaking …

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: These hardworking ER doctors are right – time is a valuable resource to fight COVID-19. Staying home slows the spread of this virus and buys us time. Thank you to all the Montanans doing their part. https://billingsgazette.com/news/state-and-regional/billings-emergency-docs-need-your-help-stay-home/article_ec92aa68-502f-592e-be70-b55e460110fa.html#tracking-source=home-top-story …

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: We must take COVID-19 seriously, and we must prepare for the curve to go up. But with a continued focus on working together as Montanans, our state can get out in front of this.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: At the same time we are extending closures, we are also preparing for a potential increase of patients at our hospitals. We are doing everything we can as a state to prepare to take care of critically ill patients and ensure there is hospital space and supplies to respond.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Stay at home, if you can. Don’t hang out in big groups. Stay six feet part from others, when you can. Don’t go to the grocery store every single day, plan ahead to limit your contact with others.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Montanans have an obligation to slow the spread of this virus. Our fellow Montanans can all continue to set a good example for each other in adhering to social distancing directives – and know that it will save lives.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: It is the actions we are taking today – and actions businesses, individuals and each of us take today and in the immediate future that will lessen the spread in Montana.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: I am prohibiting non-essential social and recreational gatherings of individuals outside of a home or place of residence of greater than ten people, if a distance of at least six feet between individuals cannot be maintained.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Today I announced the extension of closures of public schools and dine-in food service, alcoholic beverage businesses and other entities through April 10 and mandated social distancing measures to slow the spread of COVID-19 in Montana. pic.twitter.com/P90qL9d7Ff

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Don’t forget to look for the peace and goodness in every day pic.twitter.com/7pw1Uajm5d

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Social distancing is paramount to slowing the spread of COVID-19, but we also must prepare for a potential surge in critically ill patients. Today’s actions ensure we can focus on providing urgently needed quality care without delay. https://www.kpax.com/news/montana-news/governor-bullock-announces-measures-to-increase-patient-care-capacity …

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: On the 10th anniversary of the Affordable Care Act, I’m reminded of how far we’ve come to expand coverage through Medicaid expansion and to those with preexisting conditions. Now is the time to do more to improve access and affordability to care, not strip it away.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Access to health care is more important than ever as we face the COVID-19 pandemic.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Our hospitals and front line providers cannot be forgotten. They need the resources and support to do their incredibly difficult jobs, among mounting challenges.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: The package should also include an increase in SNAP benefits for families struggling to keep food on their tables during these unprecedented times, as well as protections for workers who are facing tough challenges such as unemployment and evictions.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Increasing the Federal Medical Assistance Percentage to 6% is not enough. It must be increased to 12% so that states can continue to rapidly respond to the impacts on our healthcare system.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: We - Democrat and Republican Governors - have asked for at least $150 billion in direct aid to states, giving governors the flexibility to direct this money to where we need it most in our communities during this time.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Governors are on the front lines of the fight against COVID-19. The Senate must give us the resources we need to help our states.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Montanans have always rallied together in times of crisis. It’s time that we do so again. https://billingsgazette.com/opinion/columnists/gov-steve-bullock-rallying-together-during-crisis/article_847a85d7-dc1f-5b62-a1b3-6ecac9466750.html …

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Montanans across the state have been impacted by COVID-19 and extending the deadline gives taxpayers breathing room without having to worry about interest or penalties. https://www.google.com/amp/s/www.kpax.com/news/coronavirus/governor-bullock-extends-montanas-tax-filing-deadline%3f_amp=true …

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: As the Senate deliberates an economic stimulus package, governors are pushing for the inclusion of unrestricted fiscal support. States are on the forefront of this fight - we must be able to address the economic needs of our citizens during this crisis. https://bit.ly/2QySqh5

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: I remember seeing your son at the national bee, Mike!

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: We face further extraordinary health, economic, and social risks if we do not act now. I do not take this decision lightly and it was done so in consultation with public health professionals. Montanans, too, need to take this seriously. It’s up to all of us to stop the spread.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Montanans young and old, in urban and rural communities, have tested positive for coronavirus. This virus impacts us all, and these actions are imperative to protecting our friends and neighbors. http://governor.mt.gov/pressroom/governor-bullock-announces-closure-of-dine-in-food-service-and-alcoholic-beverage-businesses-and-other-activities-that-pose-enhanced-risks-to-curtail-spread-of-covid-19 …

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Today I issued a travel advisory recommending all Montanans who return from international travel to self-quarantine for 14 days. By staying home after traveling, Montanans can play a key role in preventing COVID-19 spread in their community. pic.twitter.com/U4eDqnUmP7

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Help them help you — stay home to  flatten the curve so our healthcare facilities aren’t overwhelmed and our health workers minimize their exposure to COVID-19. https://twitter.com/MontanaDES/status/1240733300454391809 …

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: I’d like to thank providers across the state who are on the front lines, balancing routine care with the new volume created by COVID-19. We truly couldn’t do this without you, and I admire your fearless dedication to Montanans.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Expanding telemedicine will provide the physical, mental, and substance use care Montanans need without overwhelming health care facilities responding to COVID-19 or risking unnecessary exposure. https://flatheadbeacon.com/2020/03/18/montana-medicaid-expands-telemedicine-access/ …

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: This is a significant step in containing the spread of coronavirus. We know that the lack of health insurance often results in the delay of seeing a doctor or being turned away, which could further fuel this pandemic and put other Montanans at risk. https://www.kpax.com/news/montana-news/governor-bullock-says-uninsured-montanans-to-receive-coverage-for-covid-19-testing …

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: These rules will ensure that workers impacted by COVID-19, whether it’s because they’ve been laid off, are quarantined, or need to take care of a family member, can do so without worrying about how they will make ends meet during these difficult times. http://governor.mt.gov/pressroom/governor-bullock-announces-emergency-rules-to-streamline-unemployment-benefits-for-workers-impacted-by-covid-19 …

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: I praise the leadership of local communities for enacting social distancing orders. The ability to slow new infections is in our hands and our friends and neighbors are counting on us to do the right thing. https://www.usnews.com/news/best-states/montana/articles/2020-03-16/montana-closures-quarantines-add-up-over-coronavirus …

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Yesterday I announced several measures to slow the spread of COVID-19 in Montana, including closing public K-12 schools and recommending limiting all gatherings. It’s going to take all of us working together to overcome these challenging and dynamic times. pic.twitter.com/D3sGAEzgD3

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: My top priority is protecting the health and safety of Montanans, particularly our most vulnerable, at a time when we face the potential for extraordinary health risks from coronavirus in our state.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Social distancing is a primary protective measure to flatten the curve of this virus. I cannot underscore the seriousness of following these measures to help our neighbors, friends, and families.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: I encourage businesses to do everything they can to support Montana families as well.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: I recognize that our schools often serve as a lifeline for families and that this decision is going to have disruption on Montanans over the coming weeks. I’m committed to working with schools, communities and public health to minimize the impact.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Today I announced measures to slow the spread of COVID-19 and protect vulnerable Montanans, including closing public K-12 schools for two weeks, strongly recommending social distancing measures, and limiting visitation at nursing home facilities. http://governor.mt.gov/pressroom/governor-bullock-directs-the-closure-of-public-k-12-schools-for-two-weeks-strongly-recommends-social-distancing-measures-to-slow-the-spread-of-covid-19 …

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: As Montanans, I trust we will do everything we can to help our fellow citizens. We have been planning and preparing for these days to come to Montana. In the coming days and weeks, we will continue to make decisions in the best interest of the public’s health.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: The small sacrifices we make now – missing out on a cancelled event, avoiding crowds and enjoying time with small groups of healthy family and friends, and staying home if you feel sick – means keeping more folks healthy in the long run.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: I can’t stress enough the importance of the role of the public in helping us mitigate the impact of this virus. The person ahead of you in line at the grocery store could be among those most at risk of falling ill to the virus.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: I amended Montana's state of emergency to align the effective timeframe with the federal state of emergency announced by the President. This means that our state’s emergency response will be in effect as long as necessary to allow us to continue to mobilize state resources.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: The state lab is performing testing and disclosing results today and will be performing testing 7 days a week starting Monday.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Today I hosted a call with Montana press to provide an update on Montana's four positive COVID-19 cases and share additional response efforts. I’m pleased to report that all four patients are at home and recovering.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: As our public health officials work relentlessly to prevent further spread, I urge all Montanans to continue efforts to plan and follow public health recommendations to take the proper precautions.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Four people in Montana have tested positive for COVID-19. We've been monitoring this rapidly evolving situation and vigorously preparing for this virus to reach Montana, making today's news unsurprising. http://governor.mt.gov/pressroom/governor-bullock-confirms-four-presumptively-positive-coronavirus-cases-in-montana …

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Our state is preparing for coronavirus to come to Montana and we will be prepared to respond all along the way.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Declaring a state of emergency means I can mobilize all available state resources to mitigate the impact of COVID-19 on Montanans. That's why I'm doing so now, before we have a confirmed case in our state. https://helenair.com/government-and-politics/coronavirus-gov-declares-montana-emergency/article_65aadca5-cb6c-575e-a730-82c162b980cf.html#utm_campaign=blox&utm_source=twitter&utm_medium=social …

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: I agree with this approach that takes the necessary precautions to keep students safe and healthy. I have no doubt the Montana University System will continue to provide a quality education to students during this time, while prioritizing the public’s health. https://twitter.com/billingsgazette/status/1238173178972815361 …

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: We will continue to monitor the patient in Maryland and remain committed to preparing for coronavirus to reach Montana.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Earlier today it was announced a Montanan visiting Maryland tested presumptive positive for COVID-19. We can now confirm the patient did not have coronavirus while she was in Montana and has not been in the state since November of last year.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Lisa and I are sending all our good thoughts and love to the patient.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Public health officials are working closely with Maryland to confirm case details on when this individual was last in Montana. We are committed to providing Montanans with accurate, transparent information and are working to ensure details will be provided as soon as possible. https://twitter.com/GovLarryHogan/status/1237786628887724032 …

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Every student deserves an equal shot at an education. Dual enrollment helps to make that possible, while saving families money on tuition costs. https://billingsgazette.com/news/state-and-regional/montana-high-schoolers-can-continue-to-get-two-free-college/article_1ce36a27-a30c-5e4b-92ee-79fb81bc84e4.html …

name: Steve Bullock
tweet:
The Montana Boy Scouts presented me with their annual Eagle Scout report today. The journey Eagle Scouts take represent one of the core values we share as Montanans: commitment to service. 

I have no doubt their great work will benefit this state for generations to come. pic.twitter.com/9nubvRlrfy

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Today is about recognizing the women trailblazers who came before and the many still to come as we fight to ensure equal rights. On #InternationalWomensDay , I'm grateful to all of you and to the most important women in my life. pic.twitter.com/f3yozsfadY

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Since 2014, Lisa and I have partnered with @nokidhungry to increase access to school breakfast, ensuring that 61% (up from 46%) of Montana’s food insecure students have what they need to learn. As #NSBW2020 draws to a close, I’d like to thank the folks who work to make that 100%. pic.twitter.com/QHByj0vmts

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Our firefighters put their long-term health on the line each day in service to Montanans. I stopped by @Local521 this week to discuss the presumptive illness protections we passed last session and see how firefighters are taking extra steps to stay safe and healthy. @mtproff pic.twitter.com/Zd2bHAwTE0

name: Steve Bullock
tweet:
Each year, we participate in the Doorsteps to Kid Packs food drive in Helena. You can help by placing kid-friendly food items on your doorstep today, to be collected by @AmeriCorps members. Thanks for your commitment to ending childhood hunger!
- The Bullock Family pic.twitter.com/FHIhxku5rG

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Above all, use the same public health prevention measures that are used to prevent influenza. Wash your hands, avoid touching your eyes/nose/mouth, stay home if you are sick, cover your cough/sneeze, and clean and disinfect frequently touched objects and surfaces.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: I urge Montanans to listen to their local public health officials and use reputable sources for information, such as the state's health department website:  https://dphhs.mt.gov

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: This is the public health event that Montana practices for. We’ve conducted similar responses in the past. Looking out for our family, friends and neighbors is what we do. We've been preparing and will continue to address this evolving situation.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: While there are no current diagnosed cases of coronavirus in Montana, we’re taking steps to prepare and respond in the event the outbreak reaches our state. Today, I announced the activation of the Governor’s Coronavirus Task Force. pic.twitter.com/QiF18ZxcQd

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: It's National School Breakfast Week! Students who eat school breakfast have increased attentiveness, improved behavior, and higher attendance. It was great to kick off the week helping students in Billings start their day off right. pic.twitter.com/DVmBTKZkH8

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Law enforcement is often the first on the scene when responding to a patient in cardiac arrest. We are grateful to the Helmsley Charitable Trust for investing in Montana to help save lives. https://www.google.com/amp/s/helenair.com/news/state-and-regional/govt-and-politics/montana-gets-million-to-put-defibrillators-around-the-state/article_3dfacc82-20ec-561c-aca8-6ba16a22063e.amp.html …

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Over a century ago Theodore Roosevelt gave us "the great central task of leaving this land an even better land." In this age of political polarization, our return to shared values and our work to conserve public lands is what we need to chart that path. https://medium.com/@stevebullock/protecting-public-lands-our-great-central-task-79ccbd9353d6 …

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: I joined Little Shell Tribe leaders today to discuss the Census. After becoming federally recognized, the Tribe is eligible to be accurately counted for the first time ever and have access to federal dollars for education, health care, and community planning. pic.twitter.com/ygJ5w45v1a

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Montana is making progress, thanks to the tireless dedication of professionals and communities, and every life saved makes a difference. We cannot stop until even more lives are saved and until we ensure every Montanan has the support they need. https://www.kxlh.com/news/local-news/helena-news/montana-no-longer-top-3-in-suicides …

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Thanks to the folks @RockiesProject and @WstrnPriorities for being part of the force to protect our public lands, one of America’s greatest ideas and greatest treasures (and for inviting me to Colorado to brag about Montana) https://twitter.com/WstrnPriorities/status/1232757955403112449 …

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: We announced the continuation of the One-Two-Free initiative which allows high school students to complete college courses tuition-free & get a jumpstart on their college education. name: Steve Bullock
tweet: You never worked her that hard back in the day!

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: It couldn't be clearer that the President is choosing to fund his border wall over keeping our citizen soldiers and Airmen safe. I won't stand idly by until Montana's National Guard members are given what they are owed.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: As Commander in Chief of the Montana National Guard, the decision to send our Soldiers and Airmen anywhere is one of the most difficult decisions I make. It's unacceptable to me that we are doing so with outdated aircraft.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Montana Air National Guard members are currently operating a fleet from 1974, using technology no longer used by airlines. In order to pay for the border wall, the President has announced he is shifting funds that will further delay the modernization of this C-130 aircraft.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Books or movies? Yes. pic.twitter.com/QmSBSyGj2X

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: We can also agree that our public lands are under attack by Washington D.C. - facing some of the greatest threats I have seen in my lifetime. We must recommit ourselves to doing everything we can to protect, preserve, and promote our national treasures.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: While we come from all walks of life, we can agree on one thing: America's greatest idea is indeed worth protecting.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Folks out West have a special appreciation for our public lands, and we know our public lands are our heritage, our birthright, and our great equalizer.  https://missoulacurrent.com/outdoors/2020/02/poll-western-concerns/ …

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: I don’t want my three kids or yours to be saddled with this Administration’s mistakes. Billionaires don’t need a tax break, especially when it’s bankrolled by the hardworking people of our state and country.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Cutting farm assistance programs, obliterating health coverage, robbing elderly and disabled Americans of crucial services, sidelining rural America, and slashing the Land and Water Conservation Fund is the opposite of what the President calls “A Budget for America’s Future.”

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Every budget – from the statehouse to the White House – ought to be a reflection of our values. The President is showing he doesn’t share Montana’s values by proposing to cut the services that build up our economy and make our state great – all to give his pals a tax break.

name: Steve Bullock

Democrats should not be connecting the ability to be heard to money. Period.     

DNC did that in setting debate requirements & in removing them. You link money & politics, process gets corrupted. Dems should be rejecting money’s influence, not letting it guide our primary.

tweet: It’s a story that reminds all leaders – current and future – to keep fighting, to get back on our feet and demand better. It reminds us that hope and optimism triumph over defeat, and that what may seem improbable is always achievable.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: The story told of this historic day to the generations that follow us will also be one of tirelessness, of determination, and of a long overdue correction of history.
